detaileddescription.para:
Deprecated / discouraged.
YIELD is not required in Retro Rocket BASIC and may be removed. It does not solve any real problem and simply wastes time.
YIELD was intended as a hint to let other work run, but Retro Rocketâ€™s scheduler already pre-empts BASIC automatically at the end of every line. A BASIC program cannot monopolise the CPU, so inserting YIELD calls has no scheduling benefit.

listitem.para: Executes as a no-op for control flow and timing; it does not pause or advance timers.
Does not improve responsiveness; the interpreter yields naturally after each completed line.
Adds a small amount of overhead if sprinkled inside loops.

sect3.title: Example (for illustration only)
sect3.para: The output and timing are effectively the same as omitting YIELD.

listitem.para: If you want an actual pause, use SLEEP (seconds resolution).
